org.embulk.spi

Class TempFileSpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.embulk.spi.TempFileSpace

  • public class TempFileSpace
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible to manage a temporary directory (a space for temporary files) for a task.

    Plugins are expected to get this through Exec.getTempFileSpace(). Do not create an instance of this directly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TempFileSpace(java.io.File dir)
      Deprecated. 
      It has been deprecated because it may use the same directory from different processes and/or tasks. Use with(java.nio.file.Path, java.lang.String) instead. It is to be removed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanup()
      Cleans up the temporary file space, and everything in the space.
      java.io.File createTempFile()
      Creates a temporary file with the default file name prefix, and the default file extension suffix.
      java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String fileExt)
      Creates a temporary file with the default file name prefix, and the specified file extension suffix.
      java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String prefix, java.lang.String fileExt)
      Creates a temporary file with the specified file name prefix, and the specified file extension suffix.
      static TempFileSpace with(java.nio.file.Path baseDir, java.lang.String prefix)
      Creates an instance of TempFileSpace.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TempFileSpace

        @Deprecated
public TempFileSpace(java.io.File dir)
        Deprecated. It has been deprecated because it may use the same directory from different processes and/or tasks. Use with(java.nio.file.Path, java.lang.String) instead. It is to be removed.
        Creates an instance of TempFileSpace.

        It creates TempFileSpace exactly at the specified File.

        Note that the corresponding directory is created lazily when the first temporary file is created there.

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static TempFileSpace with(java.nio.file.Path baseDir,
                                 java.lang.String prefix)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an instance of TempFileSpace.

        Note that the corresponding directory is created lazily when the first temporary file is created there.

        It creates TempFileSpace under the specified baseDir with the prefix.

        Parameters:
        baseDir - the base directory to create a temporary directory, which must be an absolute Path
        prefix - the prefix of the temporary directory to be created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createTempFile

        public java.io.File createTempFile()
        Creates a temporary file with the default file name prefix, and the default file extension suffix.
        Returns:
        A temporary File created

      • createTempFile

        public java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String fileExt)
        Creates a temporary file with the default file name prefix, and the specified file extension suffix.
        Parameters:
        fileExt - The file extension suffix without a leading dot ('.')
        Returns:
        A temporary File created

      • createTempFile

        public java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String prefix,
                                   java.lang.String fileExt)
        Creates a temporary file with the specified file name prefix, and the specified file extension suffix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The file name prefix
        fileExt - The file extension suffix without a leading dot ('.')
        Returns:
        A temporary File created

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Cleans up the temporary file space, and everything in the space.

        It is to be called along with Embulk's cleanup process. Plugins should not call this directly.
